name: src/client/js/app.js
validNick

return.description: true if the nickname is valid, false otherwise

name: allBlueprintsSelected
description: Returns true if all four blueprint slots are filled.

description: Its a method for testing stuff

description: Transitions from in-game displays to the main menu.

params.description: The message to be displayed in the menu after disconnect.

params.name: isError
params.description: True if the game quit was due to an error; false otherwise.

description: Binds handlerMethod to onclick event for element id.

params.description: The id of the element to show

name: hideElement
description: Hides a visible element

params.name: el
params.description: The id of the element to hide

name: updateAtomList
description:
Updates the list of atoms that the player holds.
Only updates the entry for the particular ID given.

params.name: atomID
params.description: The ID of the atom to update.

params.name: selectedSlot
params.description: The index of the selected slot. 0-3

name: updateScores
description: Updates the team scoreboard on screen.

name: updateLobby
description: Run on new player join to sync lobby information

name: displayWinner
description: Displays the winner panel after a game has concluded.

params.name: data
params.description: Server sent data, including name and score of winning team.

name: getCompoundFormula
description: Gets the formatted formula of a compound (e.g. C6H12O6).

params.name: blueprint
params.description: The blueprint object as defined in blueprints.js

name: canCraft
description:
Returns true if the player has the materials necessary to create a particular blueprint.
ONLY USE FOR BUTTON GRAPHICS!!! True checking is done serverside.

params.name: blueprint
params.description: The name of the blueprint to check.

name: src/client/js/lib/keyboard.js
src/client/js/obj/blueprints.js
BLUEPRINTS
description:
This constant stores all data that is used to define Blueprints, 
which define the recipe and behaviors of Compounds.

Fields required:
Name: The formatted name of the compound to display
Tooltip: Description of compound
Texture: Path to image to load
Type: Class of compound. Each different type has a different behavior as defined in `compound.js`.
Params: Optional parameters to pass to the compound class associated with the given type.
Atoms: How to make the compound. Format is `Element symbol: Number required`. All excluded atoms will be considered 0.

name: src/client/js/obj/create.js
createRenderAtom
description: Renders a new atom.

params.name: data

name: createRenderCompound
description: Recreates an already spawned compound on the clientside based on server data.

params.name: data

name: requestCreateCompound
description: Creates a Compound by sending a request to the server.

unknown.tagValue: true if successful, false if the compound was not requested.

params.name: blueprint
params.description: Then blueprint to create the compound from

return.description: true if successful, false if the compound was not requested.

name: src/client/js/obj/gameobject.js
GameObject
description:
GameObject class that all objects in the game space should inherit.
Provides standard field variables such as posX and posY, as well as 
standard methods to manipulate them.

A GameObject cannot be added directly; it must be inherited.
setup() and tick() must be overridden.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new GameObject.

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture associated with this sprite

params.name: id
params.description: Unique identifier- for example, socket ID for players, numerical ID for atoms

name: setCoordinates
description: Sets global coordinates of this player

name: setData
description: Sets global coordinates and speeds of this player

name: draw
description:
Call during tick() if necessary. 
Draws object in the correct position on the player screen.

name: hide
description:
TEMP
Moves this object to (9999, 9999) on local screen space, effectively
hiding it from view.

name: setup
description: Override optional. Called once, during game setup phase.

name: tick
description: Override optional. Default behavior: handles movement. Call super.tick() from child class if movable.

params.name: noDraw
params.description: true if tick() should only process movement, not drawing.

name: destroy
description: Destroyes the Sprite

name: src/client/js/obj/maptile.js
MapTile
description: One Tile component of the map.

name: constructor
description: Constructs one Tile to add to the map.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the tile to place. Takes this name from `tiles.js` and loads its resources

params.name: gridX
params.description: X-coordinate on the grid. Every 1 gridX = 400 posX

name: tick
description: Draws object in the correct position on the player screen.

name: src/client/js/obj/player.js
constructor
description:
Constructor for creating a new Player in the server side.
Player is a Sprite instance that can be added to the stage.
Each Player should only be created once, and updated subsequently with
setData().

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture associated with this sprite

params.name: room
params.description: Room that the player belongs to

params.name: team
params.description: Team that the player belongs to

name: setup
description: First-time setup for this player. All of the functions in this method will only be called once.

name: tick
description:
Draws all components of a given player.
This method should be included in the ticker and called once a frame.
Therefore, all setup tasks
should be called in setup().

name: src/client/js/obj/tiles.js
TILES
description:
This constant contains all data on how to draw and manage tiles. 

Fields required:
type: Choose one: spawner, teamBase, wall
params: Different for each type. For example, spawner will require the `atomToSpawn` param, and teamBase will require the `teamName` param.
texture: String path of the texture file for this texture, starting in the `map` folder. (ex. 'foo.png' corresponds to '../../assets/map/Tiles/foo.png')

name: MAP_LAYOUT
description:
2D array containing the entire map tile layout. Top left is (0,0), furthest right is (n, 0) and furthest bottom is (0, n).
Shortcuts:
E = Empty
O = Oxygen
N = Nitrogen
C = Carbon

types: {"E": string, "O": string, "N": string, "C": string, "H": string, "F": string, "q": string, "w": string, "e": string, "a": string, "d": string, "z": string, "x": string, "c": string}

name: src/client/js/pixigame.js
registerCallbacks
description: Sets up the stage. Call after init(), and begins the draw() loop once complete.

name: draw
description:
Called once per frame. Updates all moving sprites on the stage.
Also checks key inputs.

name: toggleMenu
description: Shows or hides the in-game menu box

name: clearStage
description: Remove all elements pre-rendered on stage.

name: destroyPIXI
description: Destroy everything in PIXI. DANGEROUS avoid!

name: showGameUI
description: Call this function to hide loading div and show UI

name: createPlayer
description: Creates a Player instance once the stage is fully set up and ready.

unknown.tagValue: {Player} The Player object that was created

params.name: data
params.description: Starting values to assign to the player. Generated from server

return.description: The Player object that was created

name: setIngame
description: Sets the value of inGame

description: Called on mouse up from app.js

name: mouseDownHandler

name: shootHandler

params.name: stream

name: src/client/js/socket.js
beginConnection
description:
Attempts to connect to the server. Run on 'start game' press.
 - Manages connecting to main server vs. devserver
 - Sets up socket listeners
 - Loads textures
 - Loads pixi

name: disconnect
description: Run on disconnect to reset all server-based variables and connections

name: setupSocket
description: First time setup when connection starts. Run on connect event to ensure that the socket is connected first.

name: setupSocketObjectRetrieval
description:
Sets up socket object syncing.
Run in setupSocket().

name: setupSocketConnection
description:
Sets up socket connection listeners.
Run in setupSocket().

name: setupSocketInfo
description:
Sets up socket information transfer listeners.
Run in setupSocket().

params.name: chat
params.description: The chat client instance to be used for notifications

name: src/server/entry.js
src/server/server.js
teams
description:
Teams object containing all the currently playing teams.
Structure:
teamName: {
   room: 'roomName',
   players: ['playerSocketId', 'player2SocketId', ...],
   joinable: false/true
}

-> Create a Team when the first player joins any lobby. Populate room when this occurs.
-> Change joinable to false when a Team is either full or the game has begun.
-> Delete the room from the database when the last player leaves.
-> There cannot be two teams with the same name. Throw an error if this occurs.

name: setField
description:
Sets a new value for a protected server field.
Adopted from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18936915/dynamically-set-property-of-nested-object

params.name: path
params.description:
Array containing all of the subobject identifiers, with the 0th index being the lowest level. 
                Example: rooms.myRoom.players could be accessed through a path value of ['rooms', 'myRoom', 'players']

name: incrementField
description:
Shorthand to add or concatenate an amount to a field.
Best used with numbers or strings.

params.name: amount
params.description: Amount to increment the field by.

name: getField
description:
Returns the value given a path to that value.
Adopted from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6491463/accessing-nested-javascript-objects-with-string-key

unknown.tagValue: The value for the given field.

params.name: path
params.description:
Array containing all of the subobject identifiers, with the 0th index being the lowest level.
                Example: rooms.myRoom.players could be accessed through a path value of ['rooms', 'myRoom', 'players']

return.description: The value for the given field.

name: deleteObject
description: Deletes one of the three types of gameObjects synced to the server

params.name: id
params.description: ID of the object to delete

name: src/server/utils/atoms.js
spawnAtomAtVent
description: Spawns an atom at the vent at the given row and column.

params.name: col
params.description: The column of the vent to spawn at

params.name: verbose
params.description: True if this method should output to the console

params.name: verbose
params.description: True if this method should output to the console

name: src/server/utils/collision.js
collisionDetect
description:
Runs once a frame, checks for collisions between objects and handles them accordingly.
Run using

params.name: tempObjects
params.description: The list of objects to tick. Should only be the objects rendered on the screen of thisPlayer. Contains compounds, atoms, players

name: src/server/utils/compound.js
createCompound
description:
Checks if a compound can be created, deducts craft material, and returns the new compound.
Does NOT add the new compound to the objects array.

params.name: data
params.description:
Data sent from the client.
 - blueprint: The blueprint of the compound to create
 - sendingTeam: Team of the player who sent this
 - mousePos: Mouse position of the player who sent this. Contains x and y components
 - sender: Player who sent this
 - streamID: number indicating the consecutive compounds requested on this current mouse hold.

name: tickCompound
description: Checks compound behavior based on compound type. Runs once a frame.

name: src/server/utils/experience.js
addExperience
description: Adds experience to a given player.

params.name: event
params.description: The name of the event as specified in GLOBAL.EXPERIENCE_VALUES

name: src/server/utils/framesync.js
frameSync
description: Runs once a frame, per player.

name: src/server/utils/matchmaker.js
roomMatchmaker
description: Matchmaking system for public matches. Runs after initial socket.io server connection, but before connecting to a server.

unknown.tagValue: The new room that has been assigned

return.description: The new room that has been assigned

name: src/server/utils/ondamage.js
damage
description: Changes the health of the player by the amount given.

params.name: data
params.description:
The data sent by the client. Contains:
 - damage (number)
 - player (id string of player that was hit)
 - id (id string of compound)
 - sentBy (id string of player that sent compound)

params.name: socket
params.description:
This socket.
Must include the player id and amount to damage.
Amount may be negative (for health boost).

name: splash
description: TODO

name: src/server/utils/serverinit.js
initGlobal
description: Global initialiation. Run once on server start.

name: initPlayer
description: Run on every player join.

params.name: room
params.description: The name of the room that the player belongs to

name: src/server/utils/serverutils.js
generateID
description:
Returns a random number between between 10000000 and 99999999, inclusive.
TODO Make every ID guaranteed unique

name: getTeamNumber
description: Returns the index of the given team within the team array of the given room.

params.name: teamName
params.description: The team name to return the number of

content:
# AtomBlast.io
Our first attempt at an multiplayer IO game.


[![Inline docs](https://inch-ci.org/github/BananiumLabs/AtomBlast.io.svg?branch=pixi)](https://inch-ci.org/github/BananiumLabs/AtomBlast.io)

[Click here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1WfPeLDOq0typScXC974l0_CQz-JU2uzMb1uliLe71E4/edit#) to view our concept doc. Contact us at admin@bananiumlabs.com to request access.
name: ./README.md
package.json
